Strong portfolio demonstrating beautiful, creative, usable, high-quality products
•
Experience of working in a Scrum/Agile environment
•
Experience in using/working with D3 plug-ins
•
Demonstrable experience and knowledge in developing responsive interfaces and dashboards




Responsibilities:

- We are on the lookout for a Front-end Developer, who is passionate about greentech, to join our small and agile team dedicated to building our innovative climate change mitigation software products. You will help optimise the design and structure of our web applications and dashboard, to boost functionality and create an effective user experience.

You will have experience with the technologies used to design and develop a complex, productive and visually stunning user interface, including: HTML5, CSS, LESS, JavaScript, React JS, Vue JS, Bootstrap, and Node JS.
Duties include:
•
Developing and enhancing web applications and data analytics dashboards using React
•
Collaborating with the back-end and product team to improve usability and performance of dashboards and application interfaces
•
Maintaining brand and UI consistency throughout the platform
•
Developing new features and improving existing features to enrich user experience and access to the analytics dashboard
•
Provide semi-annual reviews for the application and platform dashboard design and functionality
•
Collaborating with the development and product team to review and renew the overall solution.
•
Suggesting, and contributing to, architecture and infrastructure improvements




Technologies:

- JavaScript
- React
- HTML5
- CSS
- Bootstrap
- Vue
- NodeJS
- AWS
- API



More:

The Company
At Climax Community, we are fighting climate change head-on through the power of technology. Founded in 2019, we are a greentech start-up whose mission is to empower individuals, households, and businesses to drive change and take action in pursuit of a more sustainable world. Our goal is to equip our community with accurate and effective knowledge on the climate crisis, and to drive actions that avoid, reduce, and offset carbon emissions.
With global temperatures on the rise, climate change is having devastating effects on our ecosystems, resources, homes, and lives. To tackle this, we have created accessible and economical tools that incorporate the latest science, policy and pioneering knowledge, to help users actively reduce emissions and achieve carbon neutrality. To reach our goal, we are growing our dedicated, talented, and driven team, to lead the fight towards a sustainable future.


PLEASE NOTE - THE ROLE IS BASED IN BELFAST OR BOURNEMOUTH

description.__cdata:
Salary 70,000 - 100,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- Bachelor’s or higher degree in Computer Science or a Science or Engineering discipline. We can make exceptions to this for exceptional candidates.
Experience of coding in Java or in a related object orientated language and evidence of commitment and ability to ramp up in Java.
You are comfortable with being dropped into challenging technical problems and being given the responsibility to solve them.
Experience building a software product, ideally over the full lifecycle from design to production and ongoing support and enhancement
Experience of and commitment to automated testing
Ability to deliver results with rapidly evolving propositions, client demands and business needs
Experience building complex distributed systems using micro services architecture
Curious and open to learn new languages and tools
Excellent communication skills (and the maturity to understand why this is vital)




Responsibilities:

- You will be working together with the team to build out a scalable cloud-first data processing privacy engine. Ideal candidates for this role learn and adapt quickly; you are comfortable with being dropped into challenging technical problems and being given the responsibility to solve them. You’ll combine state-of-the-art technologies with leading-edge algorithms to understand and tackle hard data security and data anonymisation problems.

You value working in a close-knit team with other talented people and seek both to learn from and help others. You have a positive, constructive and proactive approach and enjoy working with the team to design and architect solutions, choose technologies, implement, ensure quality and constantly improve how we work as a team.




Technologies:

- Cloud
- REST
- Big Data
- Backend
- DevOps
- Java
- Kafka
- Kubernetes
- Kotlin
- NodeJS
- Sonar
- Spark



More:

We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer who is highly technically proficient where you take a deep pride in the products you build and care about writing readable, well-tested code. Depending on your motivations, this has the potential to grow into a Tech lead position. 

About us 

Privitar is a rapidly growing Data Privacy Enterprise Software company founded in London with global offices in Boston, Warsaw and Israel; building software to enable the safe and ethical use of valuable data for analytics and machine learning. We work with large organizations worldwide in financial services, telecommunications, pharma, and government, enabling them to get the most out of data without compromising on privacy and security.

Privitar is pioneering the new enterprise software category of sensitive data management, with deep domain expertise in data privacy.  The company aims to define and lead this category, capture the market on modern data platforms; and address a social issue of growing importance. Our technology enables organizations to make data available efficiently and safely to drive data-driven decision making, capture value and reduce risk.

Backed by world-leading private equity and venture capital funds who’ve invested in companies like Crowdstrike, BEA Systems, Slack, Dropbox and Spotify to date we have raised over $150million in funding and have ambitious growth plans, despite challenging economic conditions. In 2020, our team nearly doubled to 200 people and we continue to hire great people. The company was recently lauded by The Sunday Times as one of the “10 Tech Ones to Watch,” ranked #18 on the 2020 Deloitte Technology UK Fast 50 and honoured as one of the FinTech50. 

Many of an organization's deepest, most valuable insights are derived from analyzing sensitive data. The Privitar Data Provisioning Platform enables analysts and data scientists to find, understand and share useful datasets. The platform integrates with existing metadata sources and enables users to collaborate to refine content and request new data. Data protection is achieved through a comprehensive metadata layer that contextualizes datasets and drives automated privacy enforcement through a set of intuitive relationships based on a controlled vocabulary and governance standards. By maximizing the utility of the data and expanding its safe access, organizations can improve insights to prevent financial crimes such as anti-money laundering, improve sales and marketing segmentation analysis, enhance research models through data sharing, enable cloud migration technologies and even launch data monetization initiatives.

The platform is delivered as both SaaS and hybrid cloud offerings that are optimized to deal with a wide range of data at rest and in flight and you'll join our team as we build out an extensible architecture that will run anywhere, at scale, and form the basis for significant evolution in the roadmap as we continue to solve our customers' biggest challenges and help them unlock the potential of their data.

description.__cdata:
Salary 40,000 - 60,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- We're not specifically looking for anyone with experience in our stack. We can provide full training on this, we're looking for a philosophy to development that is in line with our approach, as outlined in our JD. If you like the sound of how we work, please do get in touch.

Other important points are:
- Based in the UK and willing to (on occasion) visit our London or Nottingham offices for team get together
- Looking for a business that values personal development, and encourages contribution / collaboration to development
- Aligns with our business Principles




Responsibilities:

- Remote-first as an engineering team before the pandemic, we’re currently fully remote. We're starting to, carefully, resume meetings in person as the value of real-world interaction is high. Our team currently covers the Midlands, South of England, and Spain.

Meetups will happen in London where we have an office in a shared space, or Nottingham where our dedicated company HQ is.

As a team we have a daily sit-down, and weekly planning/review meetings. As a company we have a weekly all-hands call to share our work, successes, and challenges,. We use our principles to guide our behaviour.

Team meetups are likely to be monthly once they can happen again, all travel and accommodation necessary are covered by the company through your own prepaid card.

In 2019 we held a company retreat, that was not possible in 2020 but it is something we would like to do at least annually.




Technologies:

- 3D
- API
- AWS
- CAN
- GitHub
- JavaScript
- Kubernetes
- Rails
- React
- Redis
- Ruby
- SASS
- Terraform
- Golang
- Cloud



More:

We’ve done the hard work of synchronising with all the major calendar services and pushing that data into our Availability Engine. We’re now doing the really hard work of making that power accessible to everyone, not just developers, in a way that respects their privacy.

Building such a product requires a different set of skills to building an API, and so we’re looking to expand our team. The ideal person loves to work where the ones and zeroes turn into fonts and shapes, but I want to talk to anyone who isn’t allergic to writing Javascript.

We are looking for people who can, or aspire to, shepherd features from idea through to real-world usage, the experience to make the hundred small decisions along the way that requires, and the humility to ask for feedback at the right times.

As a leader, I strive to enable people to look to me for guidance when needed, not permission, and to give you the resources to be self-sufficient and fulfill your potential. As a team we aim to work together to produce ideas and products greater than those we could alone.

HIRING PROCESS
The goal is to discover what you will bring to Cronofy and what Cronofy will bring to you. It's as important for you to determine whether this is the right move for your career as much as anything else, so don't be afraid to ask questions.

Initial call
During a 30 minute video call we’ll get to know each other a little. I’ll look to find out what you’re looking for in your next role as part of your career progression, your approach to growing software in a holistic sense, and the kind of support you need to do your best work.

You’ll have chance to ask any questions you may have about the role, the team, or the company. Please feel free to ask absolutely anything, in the worst case I won’t be able to answer specifically due to confidentiality or similar, but I’ll at least be able to give a holistic answer.

Coding exercise and discussion
All being well, I’ll ask you to do a coding exercise which shouldn’t take more than 60 minutes. It’s not about building a complete product, as much as a conversation starter for a second 30 minute call together where we’ll get a bit more technical.
Link shortener

Meet the team
From there, you’ll be invited to talk to other people from the team, similarly video calls of 15-30 minutes. These are as much for you to get a feel for the team, as for the team to provide feedback about you. I’d like you to speak to at least two people, but you can speak to as many as you need to feel comfortable that it’s a team you want to join. Like all stages this is a two-way conversation so you are free to interview them too.

Final stage
Usually at this point we would spend a morning or afternoon together, in current circumstances that’s not possible. Instead, we’d look to schedule a call split into three main sections, with breaks in between, along with Adam Bird, our CEO and co-founder. Those sections are:
Work history - this helps us better understand your professional background
A “whiteboard discussion” - this gives us another example of how well you communicate - in-person this was you describing how a system you were familiar with worked, in a remote environment that might be a prepared presentation or image(s) shared before the call, whatever you are comfortable with
Culture fit - this helps us understand what you would bring to Cronofy and what Cronofy would bring to you, and see if those are aligned to each of our desires
For successful candidates, we will extend an offer conditional on reference and background checks.

At some point throughout this process, if possible, I would like to meet you in a suitably physically-distanced manner to make at least part of this process 3D.

description.__cdata:
Salary 50,000 - 60,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- - A strong understanding of designing and building high-performance software.
- Experience (of any kind) writing software close to the hardware (anything from assembly to Rust, C++ or beyond)
- Experience (of any kind) creating beautiful and effective human-interfaces.
- Excellent communication skills; equally comfortable leading, collaborating, or charting your own course.
- A passion for high-quality, reliable software and high professional engineering standards.
- A passion for music, audio, or the entertainment industry.
- Candour, empathy, integrity, curiosity and pragmatism.
- The ability to challenge your peers, and to be challenged by them, regularly.
- Taste (http://www.paulgraham.com/taste.html)




Responsibilities:

- - Take a lead role in delivering our vision, working closely with our CTO to develop real-time audio products bringing studio audio processing capabilities to the biggest live events.
- Develop an intimate understanding of the live sound domain and design innovative, elegant solutions for our users’ creative and technical workflows.
- Work both on our real-time audio processing engine (Rust) and on our multi-platform UI (Typescript + Electron + React).
- Become a founding member of the Fourier Audio team, shaping the future of the company.





Technologies:

- Rust
- TypeScript
- React
- Electron
- NodeJS
- WebGL
- CUDA



More:

Fourier Audio is revolutionising the way audiences experience audio by reinventing the tools used by designers to shape sound for live productions. We’re making products that rip up the rulebook of live audio processing - allowing sound engineers and designers to work in dramatically more creative ways.

We’re an early-stage startup, looking for a seriously excellent lead engineer driven by a desire to build seriously excellent products. We want someone with an eye for detail, who relishes the challenge of a wide remit with scope to innovate. We believe in “freedom & responsibility”; working with excellent people and letting them be excellent.

We can offer:

A job you actually want

- We care deeply about the quality of our engineering; great tools + great engineers + great design produces outstanding products. We don’t have any terrible legacy systems you have to maintain and we don’t intend on building any.
- A “Freedom & Responsibility” company culture. We treat each other as adults with excellent opinions.
- There is no red tape. Get stuff done.
- We’re (currently) a small team; you’ll be joining as employee #3 (2/3 founders are full-time). You’ll have significant say in how things roll, in both our products and the company, as we grow.

Flexibility

- We work remotely by default, but do actually like each other so meet up frequently.
- Work remotely, or from our office in Ealing, or a combination of both. Whatever suits you.
- Flexible hours; we’re approximately M-F 10-6 UTC, but whatever works as a team is fine.

Compensation

- £50-60k + 1% early employee equity (recent £1m pre-seed valuation).
- This salary band reflects our current funding status (pre-seed) and will be reviewed when we close future funding.
- The equity option has nice terms and is an EMI scheme, meaning you pay minimal tax if/when you sell it for lots of money in the future.

Other nice things

- No cap on annual leave. Take time off when you need it, just co-ordinate with the team.
- Whatever hardware/software you require to do your best work.
- Free books.
- Private healthcare.
- Potential for site visits to major West End / Broadway venues.
- An LGBT+ inclusive environment.

Our application process is public: https://docs.google.com/document/u/0/d/1eB6rZF33bJA06FLrQgl0N0L7NFlJS39pHb0p0zj2yTs


We believe strongly that diversity of backgrounds and experiences in our team makes us stronger, both as a company, and as people. We strongly encourage those under-represented in tech or the entertainment technology industry to apply, including people from ethnic minorities, LGBT+ people, disabled people, and neurodivergent people. If you need reasonable accommodation at any point in the application process, please let us know.

description.__cdata:
Salary 40,000 - 45,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- Produce and maintain fully functional mobile applications, supporting the entire application lifecycle (concept, design, test, release and support)

Integration of third party systems such as payments (eg Stripe), telemetry (eg Application Insights), identity (eg Auth0)

The setup of in-app and out-of-app push notifications

Write unit and UI tests .Write and maintain API endpoints needed to provide data to apps

Liaise with product development team to plan new features & design interfaces to improve user experience




Responsibilities:

- We are looking for a qualified mobile developer to join our development team. You will be working with our software engineers to develop and maintain high quality mobile applications.

The primary role will be the development and maintenance of React Native apps to provide user engagement for the company’s suite of web services. You will work with the product team and development team to implement new features to existing apps, including managing internal APIs.

If you’re passionate about mobile platforms and translating code into user-friendly apps, we would like to meet you.




Technologies:

- React Native
- MySQL
- PHP



More:

Key attributes and competences

Proven work experience in developing and delivering mobile apps

Have full working knowledge of React Native and a strong understanding of all related concepts including JSX, function and class components, state, context and styling with CSS-in-JS.

Have experience in the deployment process for Google Play Console and App Store Connect

Experience using back-end web-based technologies such as PHP and the Laravel Framework

Experience with third-party libraries and APIs

The ability to design and structure maintainable, testable code

Experience of version control (Git) and working within an automated delivery environment and an understanding of DevOps.

Familiar with Agile working practices such as SCRUM and XP.

Be able to work effectively on your own to meet deadlines

Be able to communicate proficiently with a team

Excellent analytical skills with a good problem-solving attitude

description.__cdata:
Salary 60,000 - 90,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- Our tools

•
Experience with Microsoft's Azure platform
•
Comfortable in the terminal and with command line development tools
•
Experience in working with Docker containers in Linux operating system
•
Experience within a continuous integration and deployment (CI/CD) environment
•
Experience with NoSQL databases (e.g. MongoDB)
•
Experience with a backend language (e.g. Python, Node.js)
•
Experience with a backend framework (e.g. Flask)




Responsibilities:

- Your knowledge, experience and skills should include:
•
Building software
o
Translating your solutions into code fluently
o
Solving small and medium-sized problems independently
o
Collaborating effectively in a team to achieve big things together
o
Understanding other people's code quickly when you are familiar with the language
o
Persisting until you succeed
o
Taking the lead when circumstances require
•
Learning and teaching
o
Curiosity and a growth mindset
o
Sharing your knowledge
o
Empathy for colleagues and users
o
Contributing your perspective and valuing that of others




Technologies:

- Python
- NoSQL
- Linux



More:

We are Egress

Egress Software Technologies provides industry and government-certified encryption services that give you choice and control over how you securely share sensitive information. Whether sending information via email or large file transfer, or collaborating on confidential documents, the Egress portfolio of products offers flexibility over deployment and user federation, choice over how users send and receive information, and control over how recipients handle the data shared with them.

The Workspace team are responsible for the entirety of the development of the Egress Secure Workspace product – a secure online file sharing and collaboration platform. We work with a mixture of Python (using the Flask framework) and Node.js in our backend and Vue.js and jQuery in our frontend. We deploy using Docker and Microsoft Azure Cloud services an evolving microservice stack.


As a developer you'll join a team turning our roadmap into reality for one of our data security services. With your help we will:
•
Protect our customers' data
•
Delight our users
•
Create value for our company
•
Lead the industry in terms of innovation
•
Go the extra mile
•
Support each other to succeed
We are keen to hear from people who consider themselves under-represented in the science, technology, engineering and maths communities – even if you feel you meet only some of our needs.

description.__cdata:
Salary 50,000 - 55,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- Lambeth College are seeking to appoint a highly effective and knowledgeable Head of IT Services to implement and develop the LSBU Group’s IT Strategy. In the role, you will lead the IT Services team at Lambeth College to deliver a customer focussed, responsive and helpful corporate service.




Responsibilities:

- Based in the heart of London Borough of Lambeth, the College has two, centrally based campuses on Clapham Common and Brixton Hill. We have an exciting development at our site in Vauxhall/Nine Elms. We serve a diverse community and both our staff and student make up reflect this. We are part of the London South Bank University Group which opens a wide range of benefits and career opportunities.



This role is contracted on management terms and conditions that attracts a competitive salary, annual leave of 35 days plus bank holidays and numerous opportunities for continuous professional development.




Technologies:

- Adobe CS
- Office 365
- Cisco



More:

Here at Lambeth College, we are dedicated to our safeguarding obligations. We ensure that our College is a safe and inclusive environment for everyone and expect all applicants to share this commitment. There are a number of safer recruitment checks that will be carried out if you are appointed, including a Disclosure and Barring Service (DBS) check at an enhanced level, and a host of mandatory training courses you will be enrolled on.

Full time – 36 hours per week – Permanent

We welcome applications from all sections of the community.

description.__cdata:
Salary 40,000 - 60,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- You’re the right candidate if…
-You have a strong understanding and experience with Ruby on Rails
-You’re a team player and have experience working in an agile environment
-You have excellent communication skills
-You are pragmatic and focused on finding solutions
-You have a well established knowledge of technology
-Proficiency in English




Responsibilities:

- In our projects you will…
-Develop full-stack Ruby on Rails code
-Include decent test coverage
-Write clean and organized code
-Take part in making decisions regarding software architecture and engineering processes
-Occasionally pair-program with others in the team




Technologies:

- Ruby
- Rails
- React



More:

100Starlings is a cooperative of professionals skilled at solving problems and creating excellent products that make our clients and their customers happy and more successful. Our unique mix of skills allows us to have a wide offering including consultancy, design, architecture, development, operations, training, and support.
We’ve been working remotely since before it became cool and value flexibility and trust. We hear each other out on the job, consider everyone’s input, and use it when making decisions. Outside projects we still support each other and appreciate and even help out with side projects (we have a variety of interests, from running projects for the benefit of the community, to 3d printing, electric car conversions, flying, etc).
Even though we work fully remotely, 100Starlings has an office in London and Budapest for occasional meetings and in person.
We’re not your average employer: we believe that we are a great fit for someone who is looking for something more than a 9-to-5-job, a place where they have a voice, can guide and lead. We recognise and appreciate talent, and have also successfully supported people to grow through our team – our senior members each have 16+ years development backgrounds, have contributed to Rails, Elixir, spoken at conferences, etc.

description.__cdata:
Salary 40,000 - 55,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- A human-centric UX researcher who'll drive usability changes through in-person and remote research, interviews, focus groups and design tasks.
Demonstrable experience designing and conducting user research across the product design lifecycle from discovery through to final designs
Solid experience in UX research across both qualitative and quantitative disciplines.
Experience working with design tools such as Figma.
A BS/BA Degree, ideally in Human Computer Interaction, Psychology, Communication, Design or other related field




Responsibilities:

- As a UX researcher, you'll work closely with our product and engineering teams, driving usability and design improvements from day one.
Actively participate in team discussions to identify and define end-to-end user flows.
Become a champion for our users, deeply understand them, identify their pain points through research, interviews and other feedback loops.
Explore the innovative domain of augmented reality, shape new approaches to interactivity through design.
Identify and prioritise research questions.
Design and execute studies that address user behaviour and attitudes.
Generate actionable insights that shape our product strategy and roadmap.
Communicate research findings in clear and compelling ways.
Measure the impact of changes.
Collaborate regularly using your strong communication, documentation and facilitation skills to ensure we're not only shipping great designs but solving the right problems too.
Advocate for and design accessible solutions




Technologies:

- 3D
- CAN
- Computer Vision
- Figma
- H2
- Machine Learning
- UX UI Design



More:

We're a team of creative problem-solvers dedicated to simplifying the hunt for perfectly-fitted glasses.

Our current apps for iPhone and iPad use augmented reality for virtual try-on as well as image processing, computer vision and machine learning to measure faces and ensure accurate measurements.

We're working in a domain full of interesting technical and design challenges and we need your help to make it as easy as picking up a device.

Who are we? We're FitsYou, a well-funded startup with significant partners in the industry, onboarded optical brands and decades of product and engineering experience. We know where we're headed and have a roadmap to get there. We're a division of Fuel3D, born out of Oxford University, our parent company develops innovative 3D scanning solutions across a range of industries from medical research to retail and has offices in Oxford, UK as well as the USA.

It's an exciting time to join our team, we've just released our first customer-facing app 'Mirror by FitsYou' enabling AR virtual trial for frames including support for app clips. We're actively working on the next generation of Mirror as well as our upcoming 'Measure' app and we'd love your help.

Make an impact, join a team building uncommonly good experiences that make a difference to real people, get in touch today.

description.__cdata:
Salary 35,000 - 50,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- C# / Java
Communication skills
Approachability and helpfulness
Creative
Technically minded
Problem solving skills
Objective mind set




Responsibilities:

- You'll be responsible for multiple internal applications, some existing and requiring maintenance, and others brand new. Examples of existing applications include dashboards and performance monitoring systems that help departments across the business do their jobs more effectively.

You'll also be maintaining a system used by some of our clients as and when required. You'll be responsible for multiple applications and projects at once, as well as planning your own sprints and schedule.
You'll be working full stack in a team of two. That means your opinions on what steps to take, or what technologies to try will be heard. You can directly impact the continued success of our internal and external products, and take ownership of new projects too.
We provide an internal training budget, and you can decide what books, courses, or conferences you want to spend that in. You'll already have access to PluralSight as well as other materials from our vendors.




Technologies:

- C#
- .NET Core
- ASP.NET
- Blazor
- SQL
- JavaScript
- HTML5



More:

The benefits package consists of:
•
4X salary death in service insurance
•
4X salary critical illness insurance
•
a 4% matched pension
•
a private counsellor
•
individual yearly training budget
•
33 days leave including 8 bank holidays
•
ride2work scheme
•
team social events

description.__cdata:
Salary 40,000 - 70,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- Passion for iOS development and a desire to evaluate and learn new platform and language features.
Significant experience building apps with Swift and solving non-trivial problems.
Experience designing and building complex user interfaces.
A willingness to improve yourself, the team, products and processes by giving and receiving feedback and suggestions, whether through code review, pair programming or retrospectives.
Proficiency using Git (command-line or via tools) as part of a collaborative working practice.




Responsibilities:

- As an iOS engineer you'll join our small team consisting of engineering veterans with backgrounds from iOS, C++, data science, 3D modelling and Quality Assurance.
Our iOS apps are 100% Swift, built using SwiftUI, Combine and Concurrency with a minimum deployment target of iOS 15. There’s no mountain of tech debt to inherit, we track and make time for tech debt as part of our process.
We follow Agile processes as a guide to help us iterate quickly and release QA tested app updates weekly without feeling like the house is on fire.
We have existing CI using Fastlane through Azure DevOps for automated unit and UI testing as well as release management. We pragmatically write unit tests to ensure code quality and work alongside our QA on UI tests.
As a tech-centric organisation, our engineers are fundamental to our success, your contributions will make a big impact. We aim to ship changes that make a real difference to users every single week.




Technologies:

- 3D
- Azure
- C
- CAN
- Computer Vision
- DevOps
- Fastlane
- Git
- GitHub
- H2
- Machine Learning
- Mobile
- Swift
- iOS
- UX UI Design
- Cloud



More:

We're a team of creative problem-solvers dedicated to simplifying the hunt for perfect-fitting glasses. We're making shopping for glasses as easy as picking up your phone and we need your help to move quicker and think bigger.

Our current solutions use augmented reality backed by patented computer vision processing to ensure accurate measurements and let our users try on frames virtually for style and the perfect fit.

We're a well-funded startup with significant partners in the industry, onboarded optical brands and decades of product and engineering experience. We know where we're headed and have a roadmap to get there. We're a division of Fuel3D, born out of Oxford University, our parent company develops innovative 3D scanning solutions across a range of industries from medical research to retail and has offices in Oxford, UK as well as the USA.

It's an exciting time to join our team, we've just released our first customer-facing app 'Mirror by FitsYou' enabling AR virtual trial for frames including support for app clips. We're actively working on the next generation of Mirror as well as our upcoming 'Measure' app and we'd love your help.
Make an impact, join a team building uncommonly good experiences that make a difference to real people, get in touch today.

description.__cdata:
Salary 30,000 - 45,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- Proven work experience as an Embedded Software Developer or similar role.
Up to date knowledge of C/C++.
Familiarity with Windows or Linux OS




Responsibilities:

- •
Develop middleware based on C/C++ / code, integrate, test and debug software written in C/C++.
•
Develop or customise board support packages (BSP) for hardware to provide additional functionality, such as software updates, enhanced security, and optimisation.
•
Development on ARM architecture.
•
Participate in software architectural discussions.
•
Work closely with Project Managers to keep schedules, project requirements, specifications, and deliverables.
•
Design and implementation of CI/CD systems to support project development.
•
Validation of the chosen solutions against the requirements.
•
Mentor juniors.




Technologies:

- C
- C++
- Embedded



More:

Since its creation in 2009, FORTIL, an engineering consultancy now has 20 branch offices across Europe including UK, France, Switzerland, Belgium and Italy with more than 800 employees. We have a common objective: grow and develop along with our teams.
OFFICE PRESENTATION
Joining FORTIL UK means joining a team of business engineers and recruiters. Established for a year in the South West region, our expertise is in Energy, Transport and Life Sciences. This first year has been a success thanks to our consultants who are both technical experts and drivers of innovative ideas.
FORTIL UK guides start-ups and big groups and meet their needs by providing skilled and talented project teams and individual consultants. We deploy custom-made solutions to offer relevant advice and we put our know-hows and recruitment experiences to the service of our clients’ projects.

FORTIL UK guides start-ups and big groups and meet their needs by providing skilled and talented project teams and individual consultants. We deploy custom-made solutions to offer relevant advice and we put our know-hows and recruitment experiences to the service of our clients’ projects.

Salary 65,000 - 80,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- Role: Senior Software Developer (Frontend, Vue.js, PHP)
Industry: Martech
Location: Towcester, Northamptonshire
Salary: Very Competitive + Bonus + Pension + Life Insurance + Health Insurance + Hybrid Working



Who you are

Educated to a degree level in an appropriate technical subject (e.g. software engineering) or with equivalent technical training
7+ years experience in a software development role
Strong frontend programming skills and experience with modern frameworks expertise in Vue.js would be best but transferable skills from other frameworks such as React would be OK
Proficient working with all core web technologies; Javascript, HTML, CSS
PHP programming skills
Knowledge of SQL database use
Experience working with APIs
Experience working in an agile team
Can work on own initiative, ‘can do’ attitude
Logical problem solver
Strong communication skills and ability to explain complex technical solutions simply to others
A team player that thrives when working as part of a team




Responsibilities:

- .




Technologies:

- Vue
- PHP
- HTML5
- CSS
- JavaScript
- MySQL



More:

Are you a “Customer-centric” SaaS Frontend Dev who wants to be truly engaged in your work, values real collaboration and loves to see your ideas for new features and improvements implemented onto a cutting edge data analytics & engagement platform for the benefit of your users?


Are you driven to deliver complex large scale technical solutions? Do you want to work in a fantastic growth focused environment where you can really build your career and turbo boost your personal development & tech skills?


If so, then my client wants you to be part of their world class agile software development team.


My super fast growing client has secured a massive funding round to expand and wants you to be part of this scaling high calibre tech firm.


Already they are working with some of the world's leading brands and blue-chip clients in multiple vertical industries on exciting and meaningful projects.


From their worldwide HQ in a vibrantly hip part of Dublin they are scaling significantly to become THE best SaaS analytics and engagement platform. With offices also in UK, US, Latin America, Czech Rep and Russia there may be occasional need to travel.

description.__cdata:
Salary 35,000 - 50,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- Have more than 2 years of real world experience as a Python backend developer;
Experience with developing secure, stable and tested API services;
Any experience with developing data delivery APIs;
Understanding of RESTful principles;
Experience working with MongoDB and PostgreSQL databases;
Experience with optimising queries to achieve optimal performance;
Experience using git repository code management and experience with collaboration with other team members.
Skills using Unix systems (Linux or OS-X) because most of our Make and other scripts are based on Unix and not Windows.






Responsibilities:

- Develop CRUD API endpoints to deliver functions and data to end-users;
Develop web scrapers and perform simple data preprocessing before loading to database (with help of a data engineer);
Integrate functions to use data science models (with help of a data scientist);
Connect backend services to remote or local databases securely and develop connectors to databases such as MongoDB and PostgreSQL using SQLAlchemy;
Develop data models using SQLAlchemy to store data using validation;
Implement authentication and authorization principles and ensure security of data and requests;
Use test driven development and be able to test API using pytest;




Technologies:

- Python
- API
- PostgreSQL



More:

Who we are: We are a growing Data Science Consultancy based in London and we are looking for a Python backend web developer to work on the development of our regulation technology product.

What are the project objectives: The objectives of the project are to apply the state of the art Artificial Intelligence (AI) to the UK regulatory corpus and deliver results within a set of API endpoints, providing integration and data as a service features.

description.__cdata:
Salary 35,000 - 55,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

-
PHP
Laravel
JavaScript
TDD, unit testing and an understanding of BDD




Responsibilities:

- Working closely with the team to shape and deliver the product strategy
Employing the best practices to build and develop effective software
Focus on ensuring consistency across our products
Being part of a team and culture that is aligned with the business
Delivering value to the business




Technologies:

- JavaScript
- Laravel
- PHP
- TDD



More:

Have you bought, rented, sold or let a house recently?

If you have, you’ll have noticed that technology in the property industry is ready for an overhaul. The home moving process lacks transparency and makes what should be an exciting time in our lives more stressful than it should be. The good news? We're going to change that.

We're on a mission to change the way people buy and sell property across the UK; to put the joy back into moving. As an established Property company with 5 years of experience working with some of the biggest agents in the country, we're in a unique position to tackle this mission. Building on the success of our flagship product Spectre, we’re constantly thinking of new ways to improve the Property industry.

We're now looking for a Senior Full Stack Developer who's as passionate as we are about building great products and leaving their mark on an entire industry to join us during this incredibly exciting time.

As a key member of the Engineering department you will be involved in:

Working closely with the team to shape and deliver the product strategy
Employing the best practices to build and develop effective software
Focus on ensuring consistency across our products
Being part of a team and culture that is aligned with the business
Delivering value to the business

Who we're looking for...
You have commercial experience working with PHP, Laravel, & JavaScript
You have experience with TDD, unit testing and an understanding of BDD
You're a great communicator, love working with a team, and have strong attention to detail

Research has shown that women tend to rule themselves out of applying for jobs unless they meet 100% of the requirements. If you fall into that category and were about to rule yourself out based on the above criteria; please consider applying anyway. We'd love to see your application!

Why join Street Group?
📈 Every member of the team shares in the success of the business with Share Options
🏠 Hybrid-working - you can work from home 2-3 days per week depending on your team
🏖️ Guilt-Free R&R - £1000 towards a holiday after your first year with the team (we'll even cover the tax!)
💪 Joining a culture that supports your development and encourages growth
📚 £500 yearly L&D budget for your career development
🎂 Your birthday on us - we pay, you stay away
🙋 ‘Give something back’ - 2 paid days volunteering on us
🕒 Flexible working hours
🚀 Joining a new team in an exciting business with huge ambition
👥 Be a part of something bigger - everyone in our team is passionate about improving the entire property industry! It's a huge goal, but it motivates us to do better every single day.
🍻 Fully stocked fridge and beers (or an alternative) on us every Friday afternoon
🧠 Monthly mental health coaching with Sanctus
🎊 Company and team off-sites, events and happy hours (even while remote!)
👩🏿‍💻 A chance to work on cutting edge technology
🚴 Cycle to work scheme
🐶 Comfortable, relaxed office space for when we're out of lockdown - office dogs welcome!
🌍 Feel good about sustainability - we're a climate-positive company!
🧘 Regular wellbeing initiatives

Salary
Up to £55k dependent on experience. However, sometimes the perfect person is far more or less experienced than we anticipated. In these situations planned ranges go out the window. If you think that might be the case, please apply and just let us know.

We care deeply about helping the tech industry become a more inclusive and diverse place and we work hard to lead by example. We are committed to Equal Employment Opportunity through attracting and retaining a complementary team of employees and building an inclusive environment for all. Candidates must be eligible to live and work in the UK and be able to perform the work specified (any recruiters will be blacklisted).

Our interview process
We value transparency, and this starts at the application stage. During lockdown, our interview process involves an introductory telephone call, a take-home exercise, a technical focused video interview, and a final culture-add video interview. We are committed to providing feedback for both successful and unsuccessful interviews.

description.__cdata:
Salary 25,000 - 35,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- 1. Solid understanding of 3D geometry including vectors, meshing, mapping, probabilistic estimation, and 3D linear algebra
2. Understanding of modern GPU rendering pipeline and how to utilise it efficiently
3. Interpersonal experience: cross-group and cross-culture collaboration
4. You have a MS, or PhD (including pursuing) in Computer Science or a related technical field, or equivalent experience
5. Minimum 3+ years Experience in 3D programming
6. Solid proficiency in Python or C/C++ language and HLSL/GLSL




Responsibilities:

- - Research & plan 3D technology development with the technical team (including advisor)
- Iteratively develop 3D deformation technology in collaboration with the team members throughout the lifetime of a project, from prototyping to deployed products
- Analyse and propose improvement to the existing 3D deformation technology in the pipeline
- Perform memory and performance optimisations of the 3D deformation to meet the requirements for SaaS platform
- Debug and fix issues in the 3D deformation technology as they arise
- Document the work to enable the team to understand how the system works and how they are designed to be used
- Strong problem solving skills, critical thinking and analysis skills
- Portfolio of previous work




Technologies:

- Python
- C++
- C
- Machine Learning
- Linux
- 3D



More:

Brarista is an award-winning fem-tech start-up whose mission is to improve the way women shop for their bras. We use cutting-edge technology to create our bra-fitting mobile application which allows women to self-measure and shop for the correct bra-fit across brands and styles - using their phone’s camera. With our service, we want to enable women to do more.

We are endorsed by the Royal Academy of Engineering and UCL Innovation and Enterprise. You can expect a fast-paced, entrepreneurial, collaborative, and liberal working environment working with us. This is a great opportunity for an applicant looking to improve and solidify their technical skills. We are also an incredibly passionate team, who love collaborating!

Salary 45,000 - 55,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- 1. Experience using scientific libraries/frameworks; PyTorch, Caffe, TensorFlow, OpenCV, CUDA
2. Good sense of writing high quality code, code-reviewing, continuous integration methodologies and version control systems such as git
3. Experience in linux based systems
4. Deployment of vision algorithms in AWS
5. Proficient with state-of-the-art object detection algorithms




Responsibilities:

- Brarista is looking for an experienced Senior Computer Vision Engineer who can Lead in the full-cycle development of perception algorithms. This unique opportunity will allow the candidate to interact with an interdisciplinary expert team, improve their programming skills and utilise our growing network.

- Lead role in the full-cycle development of perception algorithms for a computer vision module
- Research and tackle challenging computer vision problems across various application scenarios
- Creating optimised architectures for the algorithms to run on efficiency
- Design and implement practical solutions using both our proprietary and real-world datasets
- Collaborate with other research talents as well as top-tier engineers under Agile methodologies




Technologies:

- C
- C++
- Python
- 3D
- Computer Vision
- PyTorch
- TensorFlow
- opencv
- CUDA



More:

Brarista is an award-winning fem-tech start-up whose mission is to improve the way women shop for their bras. We are endorsed by the Royal Academy of Engineering and UCL Innovation and Enterprise. We are currently based in Bloomsbury, London’s West End. description.__cdata:
Salary 50,000 - 75,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- Excellent experience with embedded firmware development. Knowledge of compiling and linking bare-metal software is essential.
C/C++ working knowledge and experience with build systems (make).
Good experience with debugging (GDB + openOCD stack).
Familiarity with ELF file format and binutils.
Good knowledge of scripting languages (Python, Bash).
Experience with embedded CPU cores (ARM, RISC-V or MIPS) and memories.




Responsibilities:

- We are looking for a talented and ambitious Senior Embedded Software Engineer to help us with design exploration, architecting and rapid prototyping. You will be closely collaborating with our software and hardware teams and contribute to the fast-growing TinyML field.

Responsibilities

Development of software modules and porting to embedded targets.
Multi-level performance and power optimizations on various platforms.
Writing drivers and low-level APIs for the peripherals.
Board bring-up and debugging.
Maintaining and extending the software build system.




Technologies:

- C
- C++
- CI/CD
- FPGA
- Python



More:

Plumerai is making deep learning tiny and radically more efficient to enable inference on small, affordable and low-power hardware. This makes it possible to embed intelligent, battery-powered sensors everywhere and create a future where we know more things faster. We envision a future with 100 billion tiny AI devices that create a giant opportunity for smart homes, retail, on-device voice assistants and many more.

We make this possible with the help of Binarized Neural Networks (BNNs) - deep learning models where the activations and weights are encoded using only 1 bit. We primarily deploy our BNNs on microcontrollers and low-power FPGAs. Our vertically integrated approach results in extreme performance and consists of our custom training software, inference engines, data pipeline and IP-core. If you want to learn more, have a look at our TinyML talks from January 2021 and March 2021.

Our team is based in London, Amsterdam and Warsaw and we are backed by world-class investors with strong backgrounds in deep learning and with track records of founding multi-billion dollar chip and hardware companies. Plumerai develops open-source software (Larq) and publishes world-class research on BNNs (NeurIPS 2019, MLSys 2021).

More:

Moving house is stressful.

Don’t take our word for it. Google “life’s most stressful events”, and you’ll see moving is on nearly every list.

But moving into your new home should be exciting.

Curating Pinterest boards, buying house plants, picking out furniture. That’s what moving should be about.

That’s why we’ve made it our mission to transform the Property Industry. People moving home regularly cite a lack of transparency and a painfully slow process, and that’s often due to the technology in Estate Agent’s hands.

For the past five years, we’ve been working hard to change that.

Behind the very best SaaS companies are teams of talented, highly driven people, and that’s exactly the kind of team you can expect to join at Street Group.

If you love autonomy, are naturally curious, and want to have a genuine impact within a growing company, we think you’d fit right in.

Here’s what you can expect to be working on as a Senior PHP Developer at Street Group:

Working closely with the team to shape and deliver the product strategy
Employing the best practices to build and develop effective software
Focus on ensuring consistency across our products
Being part of a team and culture that is aligned with the business
Delivering value to the business

Who we're looking for
You have commercial experience working with PHP & Laravel (we're currently using Laravel 8 and PHP 7.3 and will be upgrading to PHP 8 this quarter)
You understand the importance of TDD, unit testing and have an understanding of BDD
You're a great communicator, love working with a team, and have strong attention to detail

Research has shown that women tend to rule themselves out of applying for jobs unless they meet 100% of the requirements. If you fall into that category and were about to rule yourself out based on the above criteria; please consider applying anyway. We'd love to see your application!

🎊 Company and team off-sites, events and happy hours (even while remote!)
👩🏿‍💻 A chance to work on cutting edge technology
🚴 Cycle to work scheme
🐶 Comfortable, relaxed office space for when we're out of lockdown - office dogs welcome!
🌍 Feel good about sustainability - we're a climate-positive company!
🧘 Regular wellbeing initiatives

Salary
£40k - £55k dependent on experience. However, sometimes the perfect person is far more or less experienced than we anticipated. In these situations planned ranges go out the window. If you think that might be the case, please apply and just let us know.

We care deeply about helping the tech industry become a more inclusive and diverse place and we work hard to lead by example. We are committed to Equal Employment Opportunity through attracting and retaining a complementary team of employees and building an inclusive environment for all. Candidates must be eligible to live and work in the UK and be able to perform the work specified.

desc.__cdata:
Salary 35,000 - 55,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- PHP
Laravel
TDD, unit testing and have an understanding of BDD




Responsibilities:

- Working closely with the team to shape and deliver the product strategy
Employing the best practices to build and develop effective software
Focus on ensuring consistency across our products
Being part of a team and culture that is aligned with the business
Delivering value to the business




Technologies:

- Laravel
- PHP
- TDD



More:

Moving house is stressful.

Don’t take our word for it. Google “life’s most stressful events”, and you’ll see moving is on nearly every list.

But moving into your new home should be exciting.

Curating Pinterest boards, buying house plants, picking out furniture. That’s what moving should be about.

That’s why we’ve made it our mission to transform the Property Industry. People moving home regularly cite a lack of transparency and a painfully slow process, and that’s often due to the technology in Estate Agent’s hands.

For the past five years, we’ve been working hard to change that.

Behind the very best SaaS companies are teams of talented, highly driven people, and that’s exactly the kind of team you can expect to join at Street Group.

If you love autonomy, are naturally curious, and want to have a genuine impact within a growing company, we think you’d fit right in.

Here’s what you can expect to be working on as a Senior PHP Developer at Street Group:

Working closely with the team to shape and deliver the product strategy
Employing the best practices to build and develop effective software
Focus on ensuring consistency across our products
Being part of a team and culture that is aligned with the business
Delivering value to the business

Who we're looking for
You have commercial experience working with PHP & Laravel (we're currently using Laravel 8 and PHP 7.3 and will be upgrading to PHP 8 this quarter)
You understand the importance of TDD, unit testing and have an understanding of BDD
You're a great communicator, love working with a team, and have strong attention to detail

Research has shown that women tend to rule themselves out of applying for jobs unless they meet 100% of the requirements. If you fall into that category and were about to rule yourself out based on the above criteria; please consider applying anyway. We'd love to see your application!

Why join Street Group?
📈 Every member of the team shares in the success of the business with Share Options
🏠 Hybrid-working - you can work from home 2-3 days per week depending on your team
🏖️ Guilt-Free R&R - £1000 towards a holiday after your first year with the team (we'll even cover the tax!)
💪 Joining a culture that supports your development and encourages growth
📚 £500 yearly L&D budget for your career development
🎂 Your birthday on us - we pay, you stay away
🙋 ‘Give something back’ - 2 paid days volunteering on us
🕒 Flexible working hours
🚀 Joining a new team in an exciting business with huge ambition
👥 Be a part of something bigger - everyone in our team is passionate about improving the entire property industry! It's a huge goal, but it motivates us to do better every single day.
🍻 Fully stocked fridge and beers (or an alternative) on us every Friday afternoon
🧠 Monthly mental health coaching with Sanctus
🎊 Company and team off-sites, events and happy hours (even while remote!)
👩🏿‍💻 A chance to work on cutting edge technology
🚴 Cycle to work scheme
🐶 Comfortable, relaxed office space for when we're out of lockdown - office dogs welcome!
🌍 Feel good about sustainability - we're a climate-positive company!
🧘 Regular wellbeing initiatives

Salary
£40k - £55k dependent on experience. However, sometimes the perfect person is far more or less experienced than we anticipated. In these situations planned ranges go out the window. If you think that might be the case, please apply and just let us know.

description.__cdata:
Salary 50,000 - 75,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- Experienced and proficient in C++

Strong working knowledge of Linux

Experience using Microsoft Visual Studio and Windows

Self-motivated and organised with excellent attention to detail

Ability to write clear, efficient, portable and maintainable code

Ability to debug yours and other’s code

Knowledge of technical documentation and testing




Responsibilities:

- This is a 3 month contract starting ASAP

This role is a full stack/c++ role within Framestore Labs. You will have the opportunity to work on greenfield projects and enhancement of existing applications. You will be a key contributor to the development and success of our core product, whilst proactively trying to improve it through innovation.
Responsibilities:

The work will be varied including : realtime graphics, multimedia frameworks, web APIs, SQL, networking. Whilst you may have little or no experience in some of those areas - you will need to be comfortable adapting and learning these new skills.
You will be required to maintain and improve the current systems that we have running.
Be a part of developing our new Signage Playback System where high performance systems power cinematic experiences




Technologies:

- 3D
- C
- JavaScript
- LESS
- Linux
- OpenGL
- Python
- React
- SQL
- Three.js
- TypeScript
- Visual Studio
- WebGL
- Web
- Windows
- Golang



More:

Framestore is a global leader in computer graphics. You may not know us, but you might know our work; such as the film 'Gravity', for which we won an Oscar and BAFTA for Best Visual Effects.

Labs at Framestore is a collection of developers, designers, techies, producers and creatives who create brand experiences that employ technology and creativity to create cinematic experiences.

Salary 45,000 - 65,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- A strong understanding of graphics + motion design, conceptual design approach, and procedural techniques
Advanced knowledge of Typescript
Advanced knowledge of Javascript
A solid grasp of HTML5/CSS/SCSS/ Canvas/ Three.js
Good understanding of debugging techniques, browser rendering behaviour and performance. The work will often involve identifying and trying to fix problems within web pages.
Good knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite.




Responsibilities:

- This role is a creative coder within Framestore’s Labs department. You will have the opportunity to work on innovative, greenfield projects. The ideal candidate should be comfortable working independently or closely within a team, have passion for programming, and strong creativity skills.

This position will focus on animating visual pieces, data driven experiences and other forms of creative coding for large format screens.

Responsibilities:

Design, programming, testing and deployment and maintenance of web-based visual installations
Development of UI, UX and data visualization

- CSS
- GNU
- Git
- HTML5
- JavaScript
- LESS
- Linux

- SCSS
- Three.js
- TypeScript
- Web
- UX UI Design

description.__cdata:
Salary 40,000 - 70,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

-
- Previous experience as a software engineer or web developer
- Knowledge and experience with the basic front-end stack HTML, CSS, Javascript
- Highly skilled with Javascript and/or Javascript frameworks
- Interest and/or previous experience in functional programming




Responsibilities:

- - Hands-on development, iterating designs, and testing of the ARIC™ UI
- Build pioneering new features that adhere to Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG)
- Reporting progress on feature development or assigned tasks
- Participate in and request code reviews
- Contribute to feature design and planning meetings
- Co-ordinate integration of cross-functional features with developers from other teams
- Creating and maintaining internal technical documentation relating to UI functionality




Technologies:

- CSS
- SQL
- Java
- Python



More:

The Opportunity
We are looking for an experienced front-end or full stack developer with a passion for building highly usable front-ends to join our UI team in Cambridge as a UI Engineer. As a UI Engineer at Featurespace, you will be joining the team responsible for the building and maintaining of the front-end of our world-leading ARIC™ platform.

You’ll be joining a team of both front-end and back-end developers that work closely with the product and the Product Design team to ensure the UI is highly accessible, whilst continually striving for the best usability for our clients. The UI team fits within our wider Engineering department, and our UI Engineers report to the Head of UI.

description.__cdata:
Salary 25,000 - 30,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- *Excellent with numbers and technical information
*Excellent sales skills
*Strong customer service skills
*Pays attention to detail




Responsibilities:

- *Providing customers with excellent customer service from their first point of contact be that by appointment, walk-in or telephone.
*Presenting customers with the full product portfolio within the showroom from arranged appointments or walk-ins.
*Understanding the customer’s needs and advising on suitable products dependent on their requirements and the project location.
*Providing customers with accurate and timely quotes and variation of contracts to meet the agreed specifications.
*Ensuring that the sales targets agreed with the Sales Manager are achieved.
*Providing other departments within the company with accurate and timely information on the agreed contract or variation of contract.

KEY AREAS OF PERFORMANCE
The information below provides details on the key elements required for the role holder to perform effectively.

*Acts as a point-of-sale contact to all prospective customers via the showroom, telephone & email.
*Provides professional and helpful showroom & product demonstrations ensuring they meet the customers’ needs and answer their queries.
*Encourages and attends on-site sales enquiries and meetings.
*Prepares accurate quotations using sizing and specifications from architectural drawings to build a quotation as necessary.
*Ensures customers receive their quote as soon as possible from the point of agreeing their specifications.
*Effectively uses Computer Aided Design (CAD) software to provide customers with annotations of product.
*Effectively uses various software systems to build product costs
*Effectively manages and coordinates all sales leads and follows up on all quotations in order to achieve excellent customer care.
*Effectively conducts the initial administration of sales orders to allow the job file to progress to the operations and survey departments.
*As necessary, attends training courses or visits to principal suppliers and manufacturers, to ensure high levels of knowledge about the products and services offered.
*Develops a good rapport with customers
*Effectively liaises with architects, contractors and private clients to establish good working relationships.
*When necessary, attends site visits to survey and discuss suitable products and designs.
*Effectively and efficiently manages own diary for showroom and site appointments.
*Understands and regularly assess monthly targets and communicates to Sales Manager if there are any obstacles preventing the achievement of those targets.
*Accurately and comprehensively registers leads on our company database in a timely manner and keeps information updated and accurate throughout the sales journey.
*Ensures the initial administration of sales orders is accurate, comprehensive and timely to allow the job file to progress to the Survey and Operations departments without unnecessary delay or potential for errors.
*Projects a professional image to all colleagues and clients in both presentation and behavior
*Communicates effectively internally and externally
*Flexible in approach to work and accepts reasonable requests to perform other tasks within your capability




Technologies:

-



More:

Are you good with people and technical information? Do you have experience in sales or customer service?

Our team at Aspect Windows work with architects, developers and homeowners to transform homes and businesses by providing high quality glazing products, tailored to their needs and professionally installed. With a vast knowledge and experience gained over 40 years, we have become the first choice for bespoke glazing projects in Devon and Cornwall.

We are looking for a Sales Consultant to be part of our busy but friendly sales team.

The job is varied and will rely on self-motivation, excellent multi-tasking and organisational skills good communication skills both in writing and face-to-face or on the phone. The sales team works collaboratively without competition as our superior products mean that we don’t have to fight over leads – so you can concentrate on developing a good relationship with a diverse range of customers.

You will be based in our Exeter office, which includes a 110m2 showroom that houses over 100 products from bi-folding and lift and slide doors, to windows, roof lights and entrance doors.

Your day will include communicating with prospective clients (incoming warm leads only – no cold calling), contractors and architects, over the phone and by email. You will be responsible for the whole sales journey from managing and coordinating your sales leads, face-to-face demonstrations in our showroom, preparing quotations, and agreeing the final contract.

As long as you have an interest and natural grasp of technical information, a genuine interest in providing excellent customers service rather than hard selling, and a good attention to detail we can provide you will all of the support and training in our field so that you can progress.

At Aspect Windows we value people who are proactive, self-accountable, focus on solutions not problems and have a continuous desire to learn, grow and improve themselves and their roles. We want our team to be happy so that our customers get the best possible experience they can have. We’d love to hear from you if you think you’d fit in with our team

SALARY:
OTE £35,000-£40,000 (Basic £25,000-£28,000) per annum.

A competitive salary is offered depending on experience, starting from: £25,000.00, – £28,000. In addition you have the potential of achieving On Target Earnings of £10,000 and up (with no limit) from our annual bonus scheme, awarded based on sales targets.

Apply with a CV and covering letter, please.

description.__cdata:
Salary 20,000 - 40,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- - Experience of designing and developing scalable distributed applications in Java
- Knowledge of patterns and their trade-offs in a distributed environment
- Experience of relational and/or NoSQL databases for large datasets
- Comfortable working with large codebases
- External API integration




Responsibilities:

- Day to Day:

- Working within a small team to design large-scale, real-time distributed architectures
- Delivering new features: from specification, through development, QA and into final deploy
- Providing input into future technology development
- Working with Data Science teams to ensure APIs are relevant and usable
- Supporting your code throughout its lifetime
- Building custom modules for client integration




Technologies:

- Backend
- Java
- Spring
- MongoDB
- Kafka
- ElasticSearch
- Zookpeeper
- PostgreSQL
- Ada



More:

As a Software Engineer at Featurespace you will be developing new features for the real-time platform which underpins our ARIC engine, integrating ARIC into customer deployments, and building new modules to plug in to our platform.

If you want to be part of the team that builds scalable distributed solutions to process hundreds of millions of events per day, Featurespace wants to hear from you.

- Java
- Spring
- MongoDB
- Kafka
- ElasticSearch
- Zookpeeper
- PostgreSQL



More:

As a Software Engineer at Featurespace you will be developing new features for the real-time platform which underpins our ARIC engine, integrating ARIC into customer deployments, and building new modules to plug in to our platform.

If you want to be part of the team that builds scalable distributed solutions to process hundreds of millions of events per day, Featurespace wants to hear from you.

description.__cdata:
Salary 80,000 - 110,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- - Experience with line management and running a team of Security Engineers
- Familiarity with common security vulnerabilities and the ability to judge their severity and impact on the business
- Practical experience with Application Security relating to Linux, Java, and Web Client development
- Knowledge of source control and continuous integration systems
- Comfortable working in an organisation using agile/scrum working practices




Responsibilities:

- Championing application security best practices through the full software lifecycle across Featurespace Engineering
Working with development teams to build security into all steps of application development from specification and design through to build, test and deployment
Own the design of security critical aspects of ARIC’s architecture such as authentication, authorization, data protection and encryption
- Collaborating with the Engineering Technical Communication team to educate engineers on common security threats (e.g. OWASP top 10), tooling and methodologies
- Work closely with Release Engineering to adopt and automate security tooling as an integral part of our Continuous Integration process
- Manage the engineering process around triaging, evaluating and responding to incoming security issues and questions. This often includes CVEs, customer security reports and penetration testing results
- Leading the response to active application security incidents affecting the ARIC product, both internal and raised by customers
- Collaborating with Featurespace IT and Corporate Security teams
- Keep up to date with emerging security trends, threats and practices
- Management and lead responsibilities surrounding the Application Security team




Technologies:

- Linux
- Java
- Kubernetes



More:

Featurespace are building an exciting new Application Security team from the ground up, to sit within the Engineering function of our business, based in our head office in Cambridge.

In your role as lead Application Security Engineer you will be joining Featurespace as the first member of the Application Security Team, and will be integral in working with Engineering Management to establish, grow, and manage the team. You and your team will be responsible for driving application security best practice across the engineering teams developing ARIC, our real-time platform for monitoring and preventing fraud and financial crime.

description.__cdata:
Salary 25,000 - 45,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- The drive to continuously improve your technical & interpersonal skills
The confidence to inspire innovation
Relevant commercial experience of modern JavaScript (ES6+) & frontend frameworks (Vue.js, React etc)
Experience writing appropriate tests using tools such as Jest
A portfolio that can demonstrate your front end skills and commercial experience




Responsibilities:

- Crafting robust & scalable front-end interfaces using Vue.js (training provided if you don't know Vue)
Planning & implementing tests to maintain frontend integrity
Enhancing existing Javascript code to bring it in line with modern standards
Identifying & implementing new front end technologies
Applying industry best practice to the code base




Technologies:

- AJAX
- API
- Atlassian
- Git
- GUI Programming
- HTML5
- JSON
- JavaScript
- TypeScript
- Vue



More:

PODFather is a leading supplier of cloud-based software solutions to the logistics, construction & field service industries. Its mobile app is linked to a rich web application that provides big business benefits & massive efficiency improvements to a rapidly growing list of companies.

We are looking for a Front End Engineer to join our rapidly expanding engineering team. You will be working on new products and features while solving existing technical challenges. In this role you will be asked to solve problems, rather than handed tasks to do. This is an excellent opportunity to work in a high-growth environment for a privately-owned company that is taking its market sector by storm.

You code will be quickly deployed to live production use, and you'll see vans/trucks from well-known brands driving past your home that you have had a hand in scheduling, and know that you've helped cut their carbon footprint whilst helping them deliver excellent service to their end-customers.

Our offices are in the west of Edinburgh, though flexible working is available as standard, allowing everyone to work either from home or the office. We recognise that people are our most valuable asset.

description.__cdata:
Salary 45,000 - 55,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- •
Microsoft Certifications such as: AZ-104
•
At least 2 years of IT technical experience, ideally in a consultancy capacity
•
Excellent written and spoken English skills are vital for compiling high-quality reports and liaising with clients
•
Experience in PaaS and IaaS cloud infrastructure solutions
•
Experience in Infrastructure Automation and configuration management




Responsibilities:

- •
Develop infrastructure automation, including CI/CD pipelines using Azure Cloud, Azure Devops, IAAS (terraform), Azure pipelines and Powershell
•
Provide technical guidance and encourage customers and co-workers to follow the DevOps culture
•
Provide Support and Client Facing Consultancy around data security, networking, databases, virtualisation, hosting, and other areas of infrastructure
•
Act as a 3rd line escalation point for Service Desk, including incident management and liaison with clients
•
System troubleshooting and problem solving across cloud platforms and tech stacks
•
Deploy and manage hosted platforms to deliver customer solutions
•
Provide leadership for multiple client projects across product portfolio ensuring timely updates and delivery of committed tasks
•
Produce IT infrastructure policy documentation, implementation, and governance
•
Ensure that all system changes follow company change management processes




Technologies:

- ARM
- Active Directory
- Azure
- DevOps
- Docker
- FortiGate
- IT Support
- JSON
- Kubernetes
- Linux
- Load Balancing
- Machine Learning
- Network
- Office 365
- Power BI
- System Engineer
- Terraform
- Veeam



More:

Comtact is a well-established technology company focused on delivering cutting edge Cyber Security and Cloud Managed Services to some of the UK’s best-known mid-market companies. Founded by serial entrepreneur Dominic List, the company’s agility and customer focus is key to its success.

As a Cloud Infrastructure Engineer you'll be working primarily within Azure based environments for multiple mid to enterprise organisations. The role includes third-line support requirements along with project work configuring, deploying, monitoring, diagnosing, and troubleshooting both on-premises and cloud-based customer Infrastructures, Networks, Servers and Desktop environments.

location.__cdata: Caxton House, Tothill St Westminster, , London

description.__cdata:
Salary 55,000 - 65,000 GBP per year



Requirements:

- Recent experience of Java 8+
Developing on cloud-based environments like AWS and Azure.
A good understanding of TDD and BDD.
SQL and noSQL database applications such as Postgres, MySQL, and MongoDB.
Containerisation - tools such as Docker and Kubernetes.
Knowledge and experience of APIs, RESTful services and Microservice Architectures.




Responsibilities:

- DWP need experienced Java engineers to help us compile, build and deploy software services that work for us and for our millions of users. We're delivering a generational change to the way governments works. We use the latest tech and tooling - and your skills - to make it simpler and easier for people to access our support and services.

*We want applications from people who want to use their skills to build stuff that matters, alongside other passionate digital experts. And who are excited by a big challenge, because the scale of our engineering challenge is incredible:

*We have 1bn lines of code in over 12,000 code repos and 90+ programming languages. That's more lines of codes than there are calories in 7.2m Strawberry Delights.

*We run around 294 days' worth of testing every day through automation. You could get a rocket to Mars in that time.

*Our APIs receive 173 million requests, and we spin up 280,000 AWS servers every month.

*Over 22 million people - 1/3 of the UK's adult population - access our services daily. Over 100,000 colleagues and agents use the kit, tools and systems we roll out. We're one of the biggest payers in Europe with over £195bn payments made annually.




Technologies:

- AWS
- Azure
- Java
- Kubernetes
- MongoDB
- MySQL
- TDD



More:

You'll join us in one of our digital hubs either in London, or up north in your choice of Blackpool, Leeds, and Manchester.

We also all have the tech and tools we need to enable our people to work flexibly, and many of us are working remotely at the moment due to COVID-19.

We offer a competitive salary up to £64,656, and brilliant civil service pension with employer contributions of 27.9%. For a starting salary of £58,000 that would be over £16,000 in your pension pot, from us, each year.

You'll also get a generous leave package starting at 26 days (25 days annual leave plus a day for the Queen's Birthday), plus the ability to take extra days using flexi leave.

We also have a broad benefits package built around your work-life balance which includes:

*Flexible working, flexi hours and flexi days
*Hybrid working: some time in a hub with the team, some time at homeFamily-friendly policies
*Time off volunteering and charitable giving
*Bring your authentic self to work with 'I Can Be Me in DWP'
*Discounts and savings on shopping, fun days out and more
*Interest-free loans to buy a bike or a season ticket, so it's even easier for you to get to work and start making a difference
*Sports and social activities
*Working in an award-winning environment and culture
*Professional development, coaching, mentoring and career progression opportunities.
